fields.title: The Great Gatsby
fields.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
fields.description: A tragic story of Jay Gatsby and his unrelenting love for Daisy Buchanan, set in the Jazz Age of 1920s America.

fields.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
fields.author: Harper Lee
fields.description: A powerful exploration of racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

fields.author: George Orwell
fields.description: A chilling dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian regime under constant surveillance and manipulation.

fields.title: Pride and Prejudice
fields.author: Jane Austen
fields.description: A timeless romantic comedy exploring class, love, and social expectations in Regency-era England.

fields.title: The Catcher in the Rye
fields.author: J.D. Salinger
fields.description: Holden Caulfield narrates his rebellion and alienation as a teenager in New York City.

fields.title: The Hobbit
fields.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
fields.description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on an unexpected journey filled with dwarves, dragons, and adventure.

fields.title: Moby-Dick
fields.author: Herman Melville
fields.description: Captain Ahab’s obsessive quest to hunt the great white whale leads to a tale of obsession and vengeance.

fields.title: The Lord of the Rings
fields.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
fields.description: An epic high-fantasy trilogy chronicling the struggle to destroy the One Ring and defeat Sauron.

fields.title: Jane Eyre
fields.author: Charlotte Brontë
fields.description: An orphaned governess finds love and independence in a world filled with class and gender limitations.

fields.title: Brave New World
fields.author: Aldous Huxley
fields.description: A futuristic dystopia where technology and conditioning have eliminated individuality and emotion.

fields.title: Fahrenheit 451
fields.author: Ray Bradbury
fields.description: In a world where books are outlawed, fireman Guy Montag questions his role in burning them.

fields.title: The Alchemist
fields.author: Paulo Coelho
fields.description: A fable about following your dreams, told through the journey of a young Andalusian shepherd named Santiago.

fields.title: Animal Farm
fields.author: George Orwell
fields.description: A political allegory about revolution and corruption, told through the story of farm animals overthrowing their human owner.

fields.title: Crime and Punishment
fields.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
fields.description: A psychological exploration of guilt and redemption following a murder committed by a desperate student.

fields.title: The Kite Runner
fields.author: Khaled Hosseini
fields.description: A moving story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set against the backdrop of a changing Afghanistan.

fields.title: The Chronicles of Narnia
fields.author: C.S. Lewis
fields.description: A fantasy series chronicling the adventures of children in the magical world of Narnia, ruled by the lion Aslan.

fields.title: The Da Vinci Code
fields.author: Dan Brown
fields.description: A gripping thriller blending art, religion, and conspiracy as a symbologist uncovers secrets within Leonardo da Vinci’s works.

fields.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone
fields.author: J.K. Rowling
fields.description: The beginning of the beloved series following Harry’s discovery of magic, friendship, and destiny at Hogwarts.

fields.title: The Hunger Games
fields.author: Suzanne Collins
fields.description: In a dystopian world, Katniss Everdeen fights for survival and freedom in the deadly Hunger Games.

fields.title: The Book Thief
fields.author: Markus Zusak
fields.description: A young girl in Nazi Germany finds solace in stealing books and sharing them amid the horrors of war.
